page.title: 03CANON PYON VILLAGE SCHOOL
page.content: The first school was started in an old granary at the former Crown Inn (now site of Evans & Sons Agrig.Suppliers), by a Mrs H.Yeomans and paid for by her husband.After 1870 Ed.Act Church built present school outside the village to serve Westhope and Canon Pyon.Westhope also had a{Dame School,}the house used is known as School House.The{land}for C.Pyon Sch. was given by the Yeomans' family, who if school should close can reclaim it.Whilst the school was being built the children were taught in the School house next door.In 1872 present Voluntary Controlled school opened. Originally 'All age' now for 5-11yrs. Including 'rising-fives'40 children on roll,Head+1Teacher.{Catchment}area is parishes of C.Pyon,King's Pyon,Birley, and Westhope.{Parents}have raised relatively large amounts of money for swimming pool,computers,lay-by,etc.
